gui.scrolltable

Interface ZScrollTableDelegate

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ManagerReportViewGUI, ManagerReportViewGUI

    public interface ZScrollTableDelegate
    This interfaces provides the methods needed for a delegate to a ZScrollTable object. The responsibilities of a table delegate include providing information about a table (in particular, the cells that it contains) as well as responding to events that the user performs on table.

      Returns the height of the given cell in the given table.

      Returns the (uniform) spacing between each cell in the given table.

      Returns the (uniform) width of a cell in the table.

      Returns a string that is displayed in the table when there are no cells.

      Returns the header cell of this table.

      Returns a nonnegative integer indicating the number of cells in the given table.
      java.awt.Color getTableBGColor(ZScrollTable table)
      Returns the background color of the given table.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfCells

        int getNumberOfCells(ZScrollTable table)
        Returns a nonnegative integer indicating the number of cells in the given table.
        Parameters:
        table - The table in question.
        Returns:
        The number of cells in the table.

      • getCellSpacing

        int getCellSpacing(ZScrollTable table)
        Returns the (uniform) spacing between each cell in the given table.
        Parameters:
        table - The table in question.
        Returns:
        The distance (in pixels) between each cell.

      • getTableBGColor

        java.awt.Color getTableBGColor(ZScrollTable table)
        Returns the background color of the given table.
        Parameters:
        table - The table in question.
        Returns:
        The background color of the table.

      • getHeaderCell

        ZScrollTableCell getHeaderCell(ZScrollTable table)
        Returns the header cell of this table. This can be null to avoid drawing a table.
        Parameters:
        table - The table in question.
        Returns:
        The cell that will be displayed as a header.

      • getEmptyTableMessage

        java.lang.String getEmptyTableMessage(ZScrollTable table)
        Returns a string that is displayed in the table when there are no cells.
        Parameters:
        table - The table in question.
        Returns:
        A string containing the message for empty tables.

      • getCell

        ZScrollTableCell getCell(ZScrollTable table,
                       int index)
        Constructs and returns the cell of the table at the given index. Note: the cells for each index must be distinct objects.
        Parameters:
        table - The table in question.
        index - The index of the cell which is needed.
        Returns:
        A ZScrollTableCell containing the appropriate data.

      • getCellWidth

        int getCellWidth(ZScrollTable table)
        Returns the (uniform) width of a cell in the table.
        Parameters:
        table - The table in question.
        Returns:
        The width of a cell in the table.

      • getCellHeight

        int getCellHeight(ZScrollTable table,
                int index)
        Returns the height of the given cell in the given table.
        Parameters:
        table - The table in question.
        index - The index of the cell whose size is needed.
        Returns:
        The height of the cell in the table.

      • cellWasClicked

        void cellWasClicked(ZScrollTable table,
                  int index)
        Called when the cell of a table is clicked by the user.
        Parameters:
        table - The table containing the cell that was clicked.
        index - The index of the cell that was clicked.

      • canDeleteCell

        boolean canDeleteCell(ZScrollTable table,
                    int index)
        Indicates if the cell at the given index can be deleted. (If yes, a delete button will be added to the cell.
        Parameters:
        table - The table containing the cell in question.
        index - The index of the cell in question.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the cell should display a delete button.

      • cellWasDeleted

                  int index)
        Called when the cell of a table is deleted.
        Parameters:
        table - The table containing the cell that was deleted.
        index - The index of the cell that was deleted.
